summary: This document is a Florida Department of Law Enforcement (FDLE) communication containing screenshots of a Florida unemployment tax (UC Tax) database query for Jeffrey E. Epstein. It shows quarterly wage reports for an employee at Epstein's Palm Beach address from 2005-2006, indicating he was listed as an employer. The document is marked as urgent and subject to a protective order.

persons.name: Jeffrey E Epstein
persons.role: Subject of financial query / Listed employer
persons.context: The subject of a Florida Department of Law Enforcement query into unemployment tax records, showing he was listed as an employer reporting wages from his Palm Beach address in 2005 and 2006.

events.title: Epstein's Quarterly Wage Reporting
events.description: Florida unemployment tax records show Jeffrey Epstein reported wages for an employee at his Palm Beach address across multiple quarters in 2005 and 2006.

events.title: FDLE Financial Records Request
events.description: The Florida Department of Law Enforcement obtained screenshots of unemployment tax database records for Jeffrey Epstein, marked as urgent and for information only per request.

locations: 358 El Brillo Way, Palm Beach, FL 33480
1400 Centrepark Boulevard, Suite #800, West Palm Beach, Florida 33401
Palm Beach Field Office, Florida Department of Law Enforcement
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein is listed as an employer in Florida unemployment tax records, reporting wages for an employee at his 358 El Brillo Way address in Palm Beach.
The document shows quarterly wage reports from Epstein for the years 2005 and 2006, with specific amounts ranging from approximately $7,884 to $63,846 per quarter.
This financial record was obtained by the Florida Department of Law Enforcement (FDLE) on May 24, 2007, and marked as 'URGENT' and 'Information Only Per Your Request'.
The document is subject to a protective order covering specific paragraphs (7, 8, 9, 10, 15, and 17), indicating it was part of a legal proceeding.
The FDLE communication originated from the Palm Beach Field Office, suggesting local law enforcement interest in Epstein's financial activities.
